poem:
**Antiviral**

In the crossfire of confusion,
where coffee cups clash with turmeric touch,
headlines juggle our hearts like careless clowns.
Kim's whispers weave through MRI dreams,
and Dr. Google wars on our screens,
turning newsprint to quackery—
truth a fragile butterfly,
wings beating against the fog.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Antiviral: Guardian Australia’s new health column helps you determine science from snake oil Why do headlines say coffee will harm you one week, but improve heart health the next? Will new drugs really stave off dementia or are they offering false hope? Why are celebrities like Kim Kardashian telling you that you need a full body MRI? (you don’t). Who hasn’t pondered the benefits of adding turmeric to our lattes, or turned to Dr Google". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
